title: Language Education Innovation Using Design Thinking: Mixed-Methods Research and Liberatory Pedagogy Application

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Design Thinking Concepts and Practical Language Education Experience
context.additional_context: A course for language education practitioners to enhance professionalism, emphasizing critical analysis of power structures and strengthening empathetic collaboration competencies.

learning_goals: Learners can establish language education problem-solving plans by applying the structured stages of the design thinking process.
Learners can practice active listening and situational empathy techniques when collaborating with peer learners and field partners.
Learners can propose experimental solutions that critically analyze power structures in language education settings by utilizing prototyping techniques.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
